CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 8;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's ( now former ) husband , A. , attacked her both verbally and physically while they were in a public place . The applicant suffered a minor injury and feared for her life and safety . This led her and her children to move out of the family home and into the premises of a non - governmental organisation in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE A. repeatedly threatened the applicant , inter alia , to kill her and several other persons . Criminal proceedings were brought against him and he was remanded in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE a public prosecutor indicted PERSON before ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) . The indictment stated that the accused had been convicted CARDINAL times in DATE . CARDINAL of the offences had been committed in DATE and involved breaches of court or administrative orders .

CARDINAL . In the course of the criminal proceedings , experts established that the accused suffered from a serious personality disorder . His treatment as an inpatient in a psychiatric hospital was recommended .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted A. The court decided not to impose a prison sentence on him and held that he should undergo psychiatric treatment . At the same time , the court released him from detention on remand . A. was then transported to a hospital in PERSON . That hospital did not carry out the treatment which A. required , nor did the ORG order it to carry out such treatment . A. was released from the hospital on DATE .

CARDINAL . After his release from hospital on DATE , PERSON verbally threatened the applicant and her lawyer . On CARDINAL and DATE , respectively , the applicant 's lawyer and the applicant herself filed criminal complaints against him . They also informed ORG ( which had convicted him on DATE ) about his behaviour and of the new criminal complaints they had filed .
CARDINAL . On DATE visited the applicant 's lawyer again and threatened both her and her employee . On DATE he was arrested by the police and accused of a criminal offence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG arranged for psychiatric treatment of A. in accordance with its decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . He was consequently transported to a hospital in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG . She alleged a violation of LAW and CARDINAL of the LAW and of Articles CARDINAL ( § CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ( § CARDINAL ) of LAW , in that ORG had failed to ensure that her husband be placed in a hospital for the purpose of psychiatric treatment immediately after his conviction on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG rejected the applicant 's complaint on DATE . In its decision it found that there had been no interference with the applicant 's rights under LAW , as interpreted by the Convention organs . As to the alleged violation of the applicant 's rights under LAW ( § CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ( § CARDINAL ) of the LAW , the applicant should have pursued an action for the protection of her personal integrity before the ordinary courts . Reference was made to ORG decisions on cases nos . I. ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL and II . ÚS CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW guarantees to everyone the inviolability of his or her home and privacy .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL guarantees to everyone the right to protection from unjustified interference with his or her private and family life .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE in case no . I. ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL ORG declared inadmissible a petition in which the plaintiff alleged a violation of LAW in that the public authorities had systematically requested that he should submit his higher education diploma to them . The decision stated that the plaintiff should have sought the protection of his rights under LAW by means of an action for protection of his personal integrity pursuant to LAW seq . of LAW .

CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE in case no . II . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL ORG rejected , for lack of jurisdiction , a petition in which the plaintiff had complained about a violation of his rights under LAW on the ground that the Minister of Justice had asked him to submit , as president of ORG , information about his financial situation . ORG held that the issue fell within the jurisdiction of the ordinary courts which had power to deal with it under LAW seq . of LAW .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . , as applicable at the relevant time ) the president of the relevant chamber shall order the medical institution concerned to carry out the treatment of a person in accordance with the court 's decision . Where the person concerned represents a danger to his or her environment , the president of the chamber shall arrange for his or her immediate transfer to the medical institution ( paragraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In accordance with the practice of ORG ( R CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) the medical treatment of a person ordered by a court should , in principle , be arranged for immediately after the relevant decision has become executable .
CARDINAL . The Civil Code reads as follows :

“ Every natural person shall have the right to protection of his or her personal integrity , in particular his or her life and health , civil and human dignity , privacy , reputation and expressions of a personal nature . ”

“ CARDINAL . Every natural person shall have the right in particular to request an order restraining any unjustified interference with his or her personal integrity , an order cancelling out the effects of such interference and an award of appropriate compensation .

CARDINAL . NORP If the satisfaction afforded under paragraph CARDINAL of this Article is insufficient , in particular because the injured party 's dignity or social standing has been considerably diminished , the injured party shall also be entitled to financial compensation for nonpecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . When determining the amount of compensation payable under paragraph CARDINAL of this Article , the court shall take into account the seriousness of the harm suffered by the injured party and the circumstances in which the violation of his or her rights occurred . ”

CARDINAL . Act no . CARDINAL on ORG in the Context of Exercise of Public Authority ( PERSON o zodpovednosti za škodu spôsobenú pri výkone verejnej moci a zmene niektorých zákonov ) was adopted on DATE . It became operative on DATE and replaced , as from that date , LAW of DATE .

CARDINAL . The explanatory report to Act No . DATE provides that the purpose of the LAW is to render the mechanism of compensation for damage caused by public authorities more effective and thus to reduce the number of cases in which persons are obliged to seek redress before ORG .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides for compensation for pecuniary damage including lost profit and , where appropriate , also for compensation for damage of a non - pecuniary nature .
